holidays.name: National Lasagna Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to the layered Italian pasta dish that has won the hearts (and stomachs) of many worldwide. Time to indulge in cheesy, saucy goodness!
holidays.origin: This unofficial food holiday celebrates lasagna’s rich history in Italian cuisine and its popularity worldwide, though the exact origin date of the holiday is unclear.
holidays.funFact: The world's largest lasagna was made in Poland in 2012, weighing over 4.8 tons!

holidays.name: International Tiger Day
holidays.description: A global awareness day aimed at promoting the conservation of tigers and protecting their natural habitats. Roar for a cause!
holidays.origin: First founded in 2010 at the Saint Petersburg Tiger Summit to raise awareness and support for tiger conservation efforts worldwide.
holidays.funFact: There are only about 3,900 tigers left in the wild, making this day critical for their survival efforts.

holidays.name: Tell the Truth Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate honesty and candid communication. Perfect excuse to spill the beans, reveal secrets, or admit that you ate the last cookie!
holidays.origin: An unofficial observance encouraging openness and truth-telling, started by various honesty initiatives in the 20th century.
holidays.funFact: Some believe that telling the truth can boost your health by reducing stress—so it’s good for your mind AND your soul!

holidays.name: National Lasagna Party Day
holidays.description: Yes, another lasagna celebration! This one specifically encourages gathering friends and family to share the meal and the fun. Because everything’s better with company!
holidays.origin: A modern food celebration created to blend the fun of parties with everyone’s favorite cheesy dish.
holidays.funFact: Lasagna parties became popular on social media as people shared their quirky layering and ingredient variations.
